comments:
This is extracted from bug 70750

R3.0

...
But I got another similar problem, right this morning, while
trying to refactor-rename a package. See error below.

Hypothesis: is eclipse sensitive to file locks, if any?
Could eclipse lock files, but mistakenly lock itself out upon refactoring
operations?

I know win2000 is sometimes holding obsolete handles, until reboot.
I understand that any attemps to rename/delete a directory that is the current
directory of one or more process, the attempt will fail.

That would explain the package renaming, although I verified that no process is
pointing to it as I am aware, but would not explain why a single class rename
failed, since no directories are involved (and at that time, I checked that no
editors were open on that file.)

BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US

There is no evidence against JDT Core here. However the error message is not 
very descriptive. Moving to Platform Resources for comments.

Please provide the corresponding entries from the log file (not only the stack
traces). You should get an entry with the generic message plus one or more
sub-entries detailing what went wrong during the move operation. Feel free to
post the whole log if you prefer.

The log was cleared after posting the 'available' information from the view,
which turns out to be incomplete. So, I guess someone should post a rfe for the
error view, because this info you are talking about should be there too.

Question: is the eclipse log rolling? (limited in size?)

Nope, however this has been considered in the past and is being considered again
for 3.1.

About the Error log view, I believe it is supposed to make it easier when one
wants to see the errors in his/her own machine. To send the actual log contents
to somebody else (for instance, when opening PRs), there are two actions
available: open log and export log. However, feel free to open a PR against
PDE/UI if you believe it should work in a different way.

There is nothing we can do to investigate it further. I will have to close this
PR due to "lack of evidence". Please reopen when it happens again, providing the
corresponding log file. Thanks.
